alert.note: Alert for Monroe; St. Clair (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 19 at 4:59PM CDT until May 19 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM CDT FOR NORTHWESTERN MONROE...NORTHWESTERN ST. CLAIR...ST. CHARLES... NORTHERN JEFFERSON...EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN AND ST. LOUIS COUNTIES AND ST. LOUIS CITY... At 459 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Weldon Spring Heights to Manchester to Mehlville to Herculaneum, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Webster Groves, Crestwood, Columbia, Ladue, Glendale, Frontenac, Warson Woods, Lakeshire, Oakland, Lemay, University City, Creve Coeur, Overland, Clayton, St. Ann, Richmond Heights, Brentwood, Maplewood, Olivette, St. John, St. Charles, Maryland Heights, Ferguson, Cahokia, Jennings, Waterloo, Berkeley, Centreville, Normandy, Northwoods, East St. Louis, Hazelwood, Bridgeton, Lambert-St. Louis International Airport, St. Louis, Millstadt and Smithton. This also includes Babler Memorial State Park, Scott Joplin Historic Site, Route 66 State Park, Castlewood State Park, Mastodon Historic Site, Sandy Creek Covered Bridge Historic Site, Gov. Dunklin`s Grave Historic Site, and First Missouri State Capitol Historic Site. This includes the following highways... Interstate 44 in Missouri between exits 251 and 277. Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 178 and 191. Interstate 70 in Missouri between exits 203 and 231. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 700 PM CDT for east central Missouri. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern Illinois...and east central Missouri. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
